reviews.review_msg: I had the joy of having Dr. Carleton as my professor on more than a few occasions. She always kept lectures interesting and was always more than willing to help during and outside of class. I enjoyed the fact that she focused more on large projects and papers instead of a plethora of small assignments. Will definitely miss her as my professor.

Dr. Carleton was truly inspiring and made criminology a tangible thing. She brought out the very best in me and encouraged me to achieve my potential. Her lectures were well prepared, informative and she always made the information clear and understandable. I would take another class with her without hesitation.

I had the chance to have Rebecca as a professor for several classes and honestly she's one of the best teachers I ever had! She not only made the course material interesting and easy to understand, but she also went out of her way to help me and make sure I understood what was expected of me. Would definitely recommend taking her classes!!

Professor Carleton has been an incredibly affective teacher. I enjoy how she can bring personal experiences in the CJS to the class, which increases understanding of current issues. Dr. Carleton always made herself accessible to students for additional help. The essays were testing but educational and the testing was fair.

Most of the profs I've had usually sick to lecturing the course material from the textbook. While Rebecca incorporates real life examples. Upon which is further analysed by classroom discussion. She is very approachable, marks fair, and provides feedback where she would like you to elaborate more. Would definitely recommend taking her class.
She's hilarious. Course is super interesting. Pure memorization. She was also my TA and she was awesome.  You can definitely be her friend! I would definitely take another class with her!

She is very clear and her exams are multiple choice. She tries to lighten up the mood with jokes. you might not like her lectures if you are easily offended but I found her entertaining. She''s really approachable and nice. I MISSED my exam because I messed up the time not because I had a legit reason yet she still let me write it Enough said.
Funny and entertaining with a fairly easy class overall. If you read the textbook and show up to class a B is guaranteed.

good prof and very knowledgeable. inorder to do well in this class all you need to do is read the textbook carefully. all the questions on the exam is from the textbook if you dont read the textbook you will not do good.

Rebecca is seven levels of awesome. Really interested; hilarious and tries to really engage students.. unfortunately she has an 8 30 am class. Loved her class; the TA's were great and Rebecca made herself extremely accessible. Rebecca made what could have been a painfully boring class interesting and dynamic. Love her.

Rebecca is really funny! Some things could be taken as offensive, because not everything is "P.C.", but it is meant as a joke. Some people need to lighten up. She is a good teacher and I like how she structures the class so the three hours seem more bearable. Her tests have a lot of questions but if you do the reading and show up you will pass.

Horrible prof. For a 3 hour lecture, all she makes is stupid jokes that arent funny. She treats everyone like we are children because of the assumption that we are all first years, and is coming short of calling first year students stupid. Checks attendance with iclicker and made it worth 25% of the grade.

The content is extremely dry for anyone who doesn't plan to become a crim major down the road. However, Rebecca tries her best to spice up lectures with jokes! Overall, exams are extremely fair and there is usually a freebie every exam. Very straightforward class.

Honestly, crim 101 with Rebecca is not really a GPA booster, her class is indeed funny, but the material is so dry that it's hard to stay awake for 3 hours.  She makes the exams progressively harder, and it is quite difficult to achieve an A.  I'd probably recommend the other crim 101 prof
one the easiest and funniest profs hands down! I've had high school teachers harder than this prof.

Honestly one of the best profs i've had so far. She's not only clear with her lectures, but she makes a 3 hour lecture worth while. Her exams are SO easy (multiple choice) ... literally read her slides before the exam and you will get 100%. I would recommend her class to anyone!

Extremely easy prof. People need to stop saying the prof is bad when they do poorly in a class. All her test questions are multiple choice. iclicker questions in lectures, but they are easy. I legit just read and write notes on the chapters 1 or 2 days before the test and I pull off a B-. With average effort an easy B can be achieve

Her informal teaching style is both good and bad. Exams are pretty fair for the most part. They're "multiple guess" which makes them pretty straight forward. She bring in 'real life' examples when teaching the course mt which is very helpful

Great Prof. Her examples are relevant and interesting. Exams are rather easy. Coming from a business student, this is a relatively easy course overall even if you are not going to major in crim. Would definetly recommend taking her classes

She uses iclickers to take attendance so basically no weekly quizzes or anything. The grading syllabus contains attendance, 2 mid terms and a final. 25% each. Pretty straight forward. She doesn't use a mike but instead she sends out notes every week. Tries to make class interesting. Swears a lot.

*Also teaches CRIM 104* Unorthodox teaching methods but she is one of the best profs there, she's really chill and makes sure to use examples that'll make the lesson more understandable.  Really fun prof that makes sure that her lecture is as lively as possible.
Informal teaching style. Doesn't provide anything online. Doesn't use her mic. Tests aren't even on the main concepts of the chapters covered.

I don't know what everyone is talking about saying how her midterms are crazy hard and how it brings your GPA down. Rebecca is so sick. She's the chillest prof I've had. For tests, she tells you what will be on it, and the best part is, is she makes notes for you to study...so the textbook isn't even necessary. Highly recommend..

THE COOLEST. Rebecca makes an effort to keep long lectures interesting. She has funny pictures on each slide and uses lots of examples to clarify concepts. She's very informal and outright hilarious, which makes the class atmosphere a lot more comfortable. Fairly easy and straightforward exams (MC), iclicker quizzes to bump up marks. Thumbs up!

Very funny, creative and personable. She knows her stuff, and is good at relaying information while being engaging, which can be hard in a 3 hour lecture! The exams are only multiple choice, which she made out to seem easy, but they are actually quite difficult. Unfortunately the worst marks out of all my classes.

She's an amazing prof! Lectures are 3 hours, which can be a little dry, but she keeps it interesting. She's funny and creative and very personable. The exams are only multiple choice, but surprisingly difficult. She made it sound like these would be easy, but I know a lot of people stuggle with them.

BEST PROF EVER!!! Her class is the only one I actually look forward to attending! She makes her lectures super interesting and funny and makes you remember everything. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND! TAKE THIS COURSE IF YOU CAN!

Great teacher, really funny and amazing wit. She elaborates for all topics mentioned and makes sure we're interested in it too! Take her for Crim if u want it to be interesting and challenging (but in a good way).
She got her feelings hurt because someone wrote a mean comment about her so I thought I'd put this up saying how cool she is! My favourite class, and funny proff
super informal, but not that great of a prof. Midterms are KILLERS. If you're not a crim major, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. It will NOT bring up your average; most likely will drop it.
Great Prof, makes hard classes with lots of course material easy to understand and provides lots of examples to clarify otherwise hard theories.

One of the hardest classes I've ever taken at SFU, but also the one I've probably learnt the most from. I'm actually glad that this was a core course because I would not have taken it otherwise. This class is demanding, but the way Rebecca teaches makes it easier. She cares about her students and if you try, she'll try even harder.

By far the best tutorial teacher I have ever had in my five years of university! She is so helpful and goes above and beyond for all of her students. There is no way I could have got through this class without her. SO thankful!
One of my fav teacher assistants ever. She is so helpful and explains the course material clearly. If you can...TAKE THIS CLASS WITH REBECCA!! :)

Rebecca is super helpful.  She is always at school and willing to go out of her way to explain.  She uses humor in order to make the lectures interesting.  There is no need to be fearful or have hate towards this class, If you read the text, pay attention, LISTEN, and review the class is fine.

She is the worst instructor for stats. She rambles on talking concepts that she fails to explain. If you go to her for help, she will give you generalized comments. It is like she expects you to understand the material fully because she finds it so simple. She comes off as patronizing.

Best prof for CRIM 320. Helpful and funny. Makes the ultra-dry quantitative material easier to understand.  Assignments take lots of effort but still do-able. Exams are all right. Take 320 with Rebecca if you can.

Horrible teacher. Thinks she is good, but not at all. Not very helpful. Always gets off class early to smoke. Not good at explaining concepts. Talks way too much about irrelevant things, like about her life which no one cares about. In general, just horrible. Thinks she is funny but not. she is not the best looking professor. under qualified.
My fave TA so far! she is down to earth, funny and very helpful!

Seems almost incoherent at times. When you ask her questions, she talks about stuff that isn't even relevant then expects you to just know. Of course she's a better lecturer than Bryan Kinney but she's not as great as a TA as she is teaching. Very unhelpful. Says she posts notes, and doesn't do it till the day before the exam? Really?

When lecturing Crim 320 Rebecca is very unclear and not great at explaining Statistical concepts. I have also gone to her with questions in which she said she did not have time to answer (needed to go out for a smoke). She TA's the class as well as one other person and all of the people who have her as a TA as well complain about her clarity
i love this prof! best crim prof ive ever had!
She is faced with the task of teaching some heavy material, but is more than able to pull it off. On top of it all, she is simply stunning. Two thumbs up.
The class sucks, but she is an awesome TA and tries her best to be helpful in tutorials.

Never take this course through distance, esp. if she's TM-ing. Never responds to mail in time. I had to hand in an assignment where I needed help and she didn't reply. She was the sole instructor for the course. Instructors have an obligation to respond to emails promptly, especially if  the course is through distance. Not recommended.

She is kinda hot for someone with kids. Assignments are easy and exams are decent. Only beef is that during exams, sometimes she talks loudly to students, cracks jokes and basically acts unprofessional.

She's the most down to earth, friendly and helpful person I've met. She's smart and really encouraging. I think she has qualities that other profs are sorely lacking. I hope I get her in a seminar or something.

Unlike alot of TM's she knows what she talking about which is very important with a class such as this.. she goes out of her way to help students and above and beyond the call of a TM...plus she is very personable and funny...
prof???? she wishes...thinks shes a prof but doesnt have a hope. full of herself.
This prof wants you to work hard, but is willing to help you if you are willing to help yourself.
